website_summaries.verdict: The entry-level Polar H9 is the best heart rate monitor for anyone with basic needs, with a wide range of compatibility and an excellent companion app.
pros: Supports ANT+, Bluetooth, and 5 kHz transmission (Gymlink)
cons: Lacks some features you get with pricier monitors

customer_reviews.title: Woeful performance
customer_reviews.text: I bought my first Polar HRM over 25 years ago and have stuck with the brand ever since. I recently upgraded to the H9 and dear me Polar what's going on? I'm not sure if I have a faulty device or if Polar have substantuially dropped the reliebilty of data transmission. The heart rate reading frequently freezes and "flat lines" at whatever it stuck on for ten minutes or more, then it suddenly comes back to life, sometimes it looks like the reading will be accurate, sometimes it's up and down all over the place with no correlation to my exercise intensity. Very dissapointed.
customer_reviews.author: G. Ward

customer_reviews.title: Still the most accurate non-medical heart rate sensor, period
customer_reviews.text: This is just another Polar sensor. That's a good thing as it's incredibly accurate, reliable and waterproofing is solid. Spare straps are readily available. A proper electrical chest strap is a must for R to R measurements, something that you simply can't do with even the best optical sensor right now, and probably will never be able to. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Horse Birthday

customer_reviews.title: Check if its new
customer_reviews.text: Its was open and used I paid the price for a new one I was very disappointed!!! It was dirty from the inside such a shame now I need to return and order a new one
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: Works great with my Polar M430
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping the Polar M430 watch would work well as a wrist based HR watch but unfortunately the heart rate reading was not correct as it takes the HR from your wrist and not from your heart. I purchased the strap and it works 100% well with the watch and now my HR is accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Chantelle L

customer_reviews.title: Very Good, But....
customer_reviews.text: Only used it once so far, it was working flawlessly, but then it stopped 2 minutes into my run! I discovered that one of the connectors had popped out. This may have been my fault, and once reconnected it was flawless again for the next 30 minutes. I'll keep an eye on the connectors and will change the rating to 5 ⭐ if that doesn't happen again.
customer_reviews.author: Mr J

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and accurate
customer_reviews.text: Polar is known for its accuracy and it shows. Comfortable to wear and lightweight, pairs reliably every time. Gotta love a nice graph to show you exactly how unfit you are after staying up all night drinking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Connects easily
customer_reviews.text: I find to get accuracy it needs to be quite tight... the problem then is running 10k a day I have ended up rubbing my chest raw... and then you can’t use it until healed...
customer_reviews.author: djaif

customer_reviews.title: Arrived damaged/opened
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived and the box is damaged, it looks like it’s been opened. Annoying as this is a gift and the product is actually really good.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Quality heart rate monitor with great native app
customer_reviews.text: Great accuracy heart monitor, syncs easily with all my tracking apps (Huawei health, elite hrv) but best of all the native tracking app is just so much nicer than Huawei health and includes every kind of exercise possible. Worth the extra investment over a cheaper tracker. Needs replacement batteries but these are cheap and the battery life is 60 hours which is a month of 2hrs daily use (unlikely you'll be using it more than this)
customer_reviews.author: neil

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: I have used Polar products for many years and have always been delighted with them. This H9 is also excellent for accuracy and wearability - a direct heart read out is more accurate than the pulse type you get on smart watches etc. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: P G Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Very simple and cumfortable monitor
customer_reviews.text: Really easy to fit and use. I use it for cycling with a Wahoo bike computer and smartphone. So comfortable I forget it is there.. Hasn't let me down yet!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew L

customer_reviews.title: love it!
customer_reviews.text: Great HR strap. Works well with Samsung phone and appa like Nike run etc.
customer_reviews.author: Agnieszka

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my Assault Elite bike
customer_reviews.text: Effortless to use and transforms workouts with plenty of info
customer_reviews.author: Mr B

customer_reviews.title: Working well
customer_reviews.text: Connects easily. Hasn't died after a few uses like the cheaper ones have. Can't really fault it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: OK product
customer_reviews.text: does what it says on the tin, however the box has been opened, before I recieved it..
customer_reviews.author: j2t

customer_reviews.title: The battery didn't last long.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing to dislike. Good for tracking workout HR and also use it with Elite HRV to track my HRV.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Scrivens

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a month or so- rubbish
customer_reviews.text: Worked for 1 month. Now stopped. Ten years ago these things were simple and reliable. I will try to get money back. Don't buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Polar H9 heart rate monitor
customer_reviews.text: When it’s working it’s great but the battery is only lasting for two weeks before it requires a new battery!! Very disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: carl harris

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Strap
customer_reviews.text: The strap comes undone all the time and the readings aren't very accurate either.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Smith

customer_reviews.title: For the most part ok
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this device quite a few times. It connects to my running app without issue. However have found on a few occasions very inaccurate results such as heart trailing way off during a run. I also have real difficulty in getting the device to connect to Polars own app which I find odd. I constantly just get the message in the photo despite disconnecting it from other apps etc. Which is frustrating as I then can’t get it updated.
customer_reviews.author: roo1980

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This Polar HR monitor is really good and works really well with my concept2 row and Bike ergs, easily connects with concept2 ergdata and the app. I really like this one compared to Garmin, pretty difficult to compare but this can have an improved battery life as Garmin offers at least two years of battery life. The strap on this is better than the garmin one.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Zahid

customer_reviews.title: Peloton Bike
customer_reviews.text: Just arrived. Seems to work fine with Peloton bike straight out of the box using Bluetooth. Feels good quality, like the easy access battery change on the back (not changed just got it) much simpler than ridiculous tiny screws and screwdriver method on some like Garmin. Like the fact the monitor detached from the strap for safe strap cleaning. Seems ok first use in.
customer_reviews.author: Annabelle

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product in june specifically to use with a concept 2 rowing machine. It's very easy to pair with a PM5 monitor and worked fine for the first 4 months. Then the heart rate monitor failed 32 times in the space of a 10km row.
customer_reviews.author: Nigel

customer_reviews.title: Loses stars for dishonesty
customer_reviews.text: The strap measurements are complete bull****. They’re just trying to pry more money out of you by convincing you to buy an additional strap. The default strap is perfectly fine unless you’re overweight.
customer_reviews.author: CJH

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and accurate
customer_reviews.text: Much more comfortable than my old Polar HRM and seems to be more accurate too, definitely has improved my workout rate and great when used with the Polar app.
customer_reviews.author: D. J. Hemley

customer_reviews.title: only works for short period of time
customer_reviews.text: worked fine for a week or two and then stopped working. I changed the batteries but it didn't help. I send it back to Polar only to get it back with information it works fine but it still didn't work. Shame, because when it worked, it seemed to be precise devise.
customer_reviews.author: P W Narecki

customer_reviews.title: Simple, easy to use, reliable
customer_reviews.text: I've recently acquired H9 after many years of using various Polar watches and devices. It easily connected to my phone via bluetooth and also to my old Polar devices. Polar Beat, a Polar app, allows you to get most of the receiver, and capture, store and interpret exercise data. It may look a bit expensive, but since this is all you need, the rest will be taken care of by your phone, it is great value for money
customer_reviews.author: Bob.NW8

customer_reviews.title: Battery life abysmal
customer_reviews.text: This product used to work well, exactly as advertised. Something changed about a year in, and now it discharges entire batteries after maybe 15 work out sessions. I don’t know what changed, maybe an update? Regardless, I would not recommend this to anyone who doesn’t want to buy new batteries every month.
customer_reviews.author: Anna S

product_meta.title: Polar H9 Heart Rate Sensor – ANT + / Bluetooth - Waterproof HR Monitor with Soft Chest Strap for Gym, Cycling, Running, Outdoor Sports
product_meta.description: New Polar H9 heart rate sensor out now polar H9 is the ideal jack-of-all-trades sensor for all your everyday sports. Get reliable calories and heart rate thanks to chest strap measurement Battery life is 400 hours Polar H9 heart rate monitor works not only with Polar beat app and many 3rd party apps but also with a large variety of sports watches cycling devices and gym equipment. This is due to bluetooth ANT+ and 5 kHz technologies which can also be active simultaneously. Get reliable heart rate tracking for all your everyday sports now.
feature_bullets: POLAR presents a new affordable HRM when you're looking for a reliable high quality heart rate monitor for your everyday sports Polar H9 is a trusted choice of HR sensor that fulfills all your needs

Gold standard in heart rate tracking built on decades of scientific research and development recognised by both regular users and researchers around the globe Polar is proud to be the Gold Standard in HR tracking
CONNECTIVITY OPTIONS: Polar H9 connects to sports and smart watches (Polar Garmin) activity trackers gym equipment and other bluetooth and ANT+ devices
Now your cardio workouts are more effective: From gym to indoor cycling via jogging and group exercise, track your heart rate and get an accurate calorie burn
Turn your phone into fitness tracker: Enjoy endless connection possibilities to Polar beat, Polar club, peloton, Nike+ run club and other popular fitness and training apps

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars354 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
